docs.abstract: Mr. Matthews’s show, “Hardball,” has been on the air since 1997.
docs.snippet: Mr. Matthews’s show, “Hardball,” has been on the air since 1997.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chris Matthews, the veteran political anchor and voluble host of the long-running MSNBC talk show “Hardball,” resigned on Monday night, an abrupt departure from a television perch that made him a fixture of politics and the news media over the past quarter-century.

headline.print_headline: Matthews, the Longtime Host of ‘Hardball,’ Exits MSNBC

docs.abstract: As the coronavirus spreads around the world, companies are seeking alternatives to making goods in China, while right-wing political parties fulminate against open borders.
docs.snippet: As the coronavirus spreads around the world, companies are seeking alternatives to making goods in China, while right-wing political parties fulminate against open borders.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Well before a deadly virus began spreading across multiple borders, a world defined by deepening interconnection appeared to be reassessing the merits of globalization.

headline.main: A Global Outbreak Is Fueling the Backlash to Globalization
headline.print_headline: Virus Adds To Backlash To a World Intertwined

docs.abstract: In a candid interview, David Calhoun largely laid the blame for the company’s 737 Max crisis on his predecessor.
docs.snippet: In a candid interview, David Calhoun largely laid the blame for the company’s 737 Max crisis on his predecessor.
docs.lead_paragraph: FLORISSANT, Mo. — In his eight weeks on the job, Boeing’s chief executive, David L. Calhoun, has come to one overriding conclusion: Things inside the aerospace giant were even worse than he had thought.

headline.main: ‘It’s More Than I Imagined’: Boeing’s New C.E.O. Confronts Its Challenges
headline.print_headline: Boeing’s Problems  Are a Lot Bigger Than He Feared

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

byline.original: By Natalie Kitroeff and David Gelles

docs.abstract: Regulators report thousands of complaints about the calls. Here are some tips on protecting yourself, and your money.
docs.snippet: Regulators report thousands of complaints about the calls. Here are some tips on protecting yourself, and your money.
docs.lead_paragraph: You’ve probably received one: A recorded call warns of a problem with your Social Security number. To fix it and avoid legal action, you’re told, you must call back immediately — and pay up.

headline.main: How Not to Become a Victim of Social Security Fraud Calls
headline.print_headline: How Not to Become a Victim of Social Security Fraud Calls

docs.abstract: Considered a “supermini” in Europe, the Peugeot 208 beat out seven finalists, including Tesla’s Model 3 and the Porsche electric Taycan.
docs.snippet: Considered a “supermini” in Europe, the Peugeot 208 beat out seven finalists, including Tesla’s Model 3 and the Porsche electric Taycan.
docs.lead_paragraph: As if the climate for automobile shows worldwide wasn’t already depressed — with dwindling attendance and cash-conscious brands pulling their exhibits — the Geneva International Auto Show in Switzerland was called off this year over coronavirus fears.

headline.main: No Auto Show in Geneva, but the Car of the Year Must Go On
headline.print_headline: No-Shows And Virus Shut Down Auto Show

docs.abstract: American, United and Delta pointed to strong cash positions and said they were cutting costs to offset lost bookings.
docs.snippet: American, United and Delta pointed to strong cash positions and said they were cutting costs to offset lost bookings.
docs.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus has pummeled airlines in the United States, especially in recent weeks, but the industry is prepared to suffer the blows.

headline.main: U.S. Airlines Say They Can Absorb Impact of Coronavirus on Travel
headline.print_headline: With Deep Cuts, Airlines Say They Can Weather the Storm

docs.abstract: The most severe decline in stocks since the financial crisis reflects worries that a public health crisis is threatening to become a global economic disaster.
docs.snippet: The most severe decline in stocks since the financial crisis reflects worries that a public health crisis is threatening to become a global economic disaster.
docs.lead_paragraph: Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.

headline.main: Coronavirus Turmoil in 5 Charts, 10 Quotes, 5 Photos and 1 Map

docs.abstract: Europe’s social policies are sometimes seen as overly generous. Yet they may help cushion the economic impact of the virus.
docs.snippet: Europe’s social policies are sometimes seen as overly generous. Yet they may help cushion the economic impact of the virus.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Keeping your salary while caring for a quarantined child. Exercising the right to not work if you are afraid of getting ill. Sick-leave pay for up to six months.

headline.main: Paid to Stay Home: Europe’s Safety Net Could Ease Toll of Coronavirus
headline.print_headline: Social Safety Net In Europe Eases Quarantine’s Toll

docs.abstract: Moscow refused to accept production cuts to offset the effect of the coronavirus outbreak. Now Saudi Arabia is trying an alternative: inflicting pain.
docs.snippet: Moscow refused to accept production cuts to offset the effect of the coronavirus outbreak. Now Saudi Arabia is trying an alternative: inflicting pain.
docs.lead_paragraph: For the last three years, two factors have been hugely influential in the oil markets. The first has been the surge of shale oil production in the United States, which has turned the country from a large oil importer to an increasingly important exporter. The second is the alliance between Saudi Arabia and Russia, which recently have cooperated in trimming production to try to counter shale’s impact.

headline.main: How a Saudi-Russian Standoff Sent Oil Markets Into a Frenzy
headline.print_headline: A Saudi-Russian Standoff Causes More Turmoil

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

docs.abstract: The Fed reduced rates to keep the effects of the outbreak from spreading to sectors not directly affected by the virus.
docs.snippet: The Fed reduced rates to keep the effects of the outbreak from spreading to sectors not directly affected by the virus.
docs.lead_paragraph: Epidemiologists are nervously tracking signs that the coronavirus is spreading widely beyond its origins in China. Economists are watching for much the same thing when it comes to the economic damage.

headline.main: Will the Coronavirus Cause a Recession? Keep Your Eye on the Barbershops
headline.print_headline: Are We Headed  To a Recession?
